Title.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of open surgical repair for complex CJFs in resource-limited settings.

Participants.evidence: This case report describes a 23-year-old Afghan man with a traumatic CJF and right common carotid pseudoaneurysm following a gunshot wound.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved open surgical repair, including resection of the aneurysm and reconstruction of the affected vessels.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of open surgical repair for complex CJFs in resource-limited settings.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Postoperative recovery was marked by the resolution of symptoms and normal function.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported during the follow-up period.
